name: WeaponTriangleExplanation
commands: Alright let's explain the weapon triangle now

As the name suggests, weapons act in a triangle against one another.|If a weapon beats another, it'll gain bonus damage and hit rate|Likewise, if a weapon loses against another, it'll receive a damage and hit rate penalty.|Swords beat axes, axes beat lances, and lances beat swords.|Magic also has a triangle of its own|Anima beats holy, holy beats dark, and dark beats anima magic.|Bows exist outside of the weapon triangle all together, in return it can't fight back in melee range.

Sorry that was probably a ton of information, but don't worry too much about it|You'll get the hang of it with practice.|In the battle previews, you'll see an indicator if you're winning or losing in the weapon triangle.
Anyway, let's get back to figuring out how to tackle the enemies remaining.
This is an axe fighter, as I mentioned swords beat axes.|He's on advantageous terrain and has 1-2 tile range.|Take advantage of the weapon triangle to beat him first

This is an armored knight, he has a lance which beats swords.|He's on even better terrain but doesn't have range|Magic would be a good tool to cut through his defenses.|Magic can be used from 1-2 range so take advantage of the enemy's range limits
